metadata.name: Winrar Compressing Dump Files
metadata.comment: Detects execution of WinRAR in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\rar.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\winrar.exe'))) AND lower(device.desc) = lower('command line rar') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dmp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dump')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.hdmp'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of WinRAR in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate use of WinRAR with a command line in which ".dmp" or ".dump" appears accidentally 2. Legitimate use of WinRAR to compress WER ".dmp" files for troubleshooting Reference: https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/overwatch-exposes-aquatic-panda-in-possession-of-log-4-shell-exploit-tools/
